title: Seeking guidance for web-type resources
content:
Hi all,  
For a final project in one of my classes, I’m doing a bit of research on web typography. If anyone has any recommendations of resources to check out, they are very welcome and appreciated. I’ll be documenting most of what I’m reading on my site (it’s in my profile if anyone wants to look... I didn’t add the link here to avoid spamming).  
Thanks for any advice you’re willing to share.  
-Casey

 [‹ Mercury Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/typophile.com/node/19662 "Go to previous forum topic") [Belgrade Design Week ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/typophile.com/node/19289 "Go to next forum topic")
author: v-six

comments.content:
I don’t do web design at all but I’ve got a few links you may find useful if you haven’t got them.

[A List Apart](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/www.alistapart.com/)  
 [The Elements of Typographic Style applied to the Web](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/webtypography.net/)  
 [Typetester](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/typetester.maratz.com/)

Here’s been a lot of noise about font embedding for the web recently if you’re interested in that area.

[Five Steps to Font Freedom](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/www.beadesigngroup.com/blog/archives/2006/03/five_steps_to_font_freedom.html)  
 [Typophile reaction](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/typophile.com/node/18418)  
 [Fonts on the Web by Thomas Phinney](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2006/03/fonts_on_the_we.html)

and

[W3C takes a fresh look at linking fonts to Web pages](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806220157/http:/typophile.com/node/19502)
Thank you both, I’ll give those links a read.
